when_to_say: Used when talking about academics or learning.
example: 毎日日本語を勉強しています。 (mainichi nihongo o benkyou shiteimasu.) - I study Japanese every day.

when_to_say: Used to express deep affection or emotion.
example: 愛は全てに勝る。 (ai wa subete ni masaru.) - Love conquers all.

when_to_say: Used as a general greeting in the afternoon.
example: こんにちは！お元気ですか？ (konnichiwa! ogenki desu ka?) - Hello! How are you?

when_to_say: Used when talking about academics or learning.
example: 毎日日本語を勉強しています。 (mainichi nihongo o benkyou shiteimasu.) - I study Japanese every day.

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used when talking about academics or learning.
example: 毎日日本語を勉強しています。 (mainichi nihongo o benkyou shiteimasu.) - I study Japanese every day.

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used when parting ways for a long time.
example: 友達にさようならを言った。 (tomodachi ni sayounara o itta.) - I said goodbye to my friend.

example: 友達にさようならを言った。 (tomodachi ni sayounara o itta.) - I said goodbye to my friend.

when_to_say: Used to express gratitude in informal settings.
example: ありがとう、手伝ってくれて！ (arigatou, tetsudatte kurete!) - Thank you for helping me!

when_to_say: Used when talking about academics or learning.
example: 毎日日本語を勉強しています。 (mainichi nihongo o benkyou shiteimasu.) - I study Japanese every day.

when_to_say: Used as a general greeting in the afternoon.
example: こんにちは！お元気ですか？ (konnichiwa! ogenki desu ka?) - Hello! How are you?
